info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 5 at 10:56PM EDT until April 6 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following counties, Marion and Morrow.
* WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Elevated river and stream flows and lingering standing water in fields and areas of poor-drainage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported minor flooding continuing across the area, with a number of township and county roads experiencing flooding with some roads remaining closed. Locations away from urban areas and out in the country are seeing the bulk of the flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will allow flooding to only slowly improve through the rest of the night. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion, Mount Gilead, Cardington, Prospect, La Rue, Morral, Waldo, Chesterville, Sparta, Caledonia, New Bloomington, Edison, Green Camp, Marengo, Fulton, Iberia and Shauck.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING
